alert.note: Alert for La Salle; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 8:48PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Livingston and southwestern La Salle Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 847 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tiskilwa to near Washburn to near Hudson. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ottawa, Streator, Pontiac, Peru, La Salle, Mendota, Fairbury, Oglesby, Gridley, North Utica, Forrest, Flanagan, Wenona, Odell, South Streator, Tonica, Grand Ridge, Naplate, Cornell and Lostant. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 41 and 70. I-55 between mile markers 188 and 210. I-80 between mile markers 74 and 88. This includes... Buffalo Rock State Park, Illinois Valley Community College, Matthiessen State Park, Starved Rock State Park, and Tri-County Fairgrounds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
